page.title: 01BODFARI GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The rural village of Bodfari, situated in the Vale of Clwyd, is divided by the River Wheeler and the A541. On one side of the river,in the borough of Rhuddlan, is the village of Bodfari and the village school, post office, church, garages, shop and public houses. On the other side of the river is Aberwheeler, locally known as the Waen,which is in the borough of Glyndwr.Here the village chapel and playing fields are situated. It is primarily a farming area, mainly dairy and sheep, though a few crops such as corn and barley are grown.There are a few disused sand quarries to be found.Many inhabitants travel to the nearby towns to their place of work.
